title: Polish comic book - looking for similar fonts
content:
Hello,

i`m looking for similar fonts like KAJKO I KOKOSZ and FESTIWAL CZAROWNIC (see attachment file) or linked [http://www.transatlantis.net/blog/archives/kajko\_i\_kokosz.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.transatlantis.net/blog/archives/kajko_i_kokosz.jpg)

Thanks,

Ewelina
author: walkewel

comments.content:
Cześć Ewelina,  
welcome to Typophile!

Obviously, both styles are hand-lettered.  
For ‘Kajko I Kokosz’, you might find something similar at these sites dedicated to comic lettering fonts:  
 [Blambot](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.blambot.com/fonts.shtml)  
 [Comicraft](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.comicraft.com/fonts/)/ [Comic Book Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.comicbookfonts.com/fonts)  
For example, [Boogers](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.blambot.com/font_boogers.shtml) is not that different.

‘Festiwal Czarownic’ is more difficult. It looks a bit like an exaggerated [Pivo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-72-pivo).  
F

Cześć ;-)

Thank You for Your replay and interesting links.

1.Boogers font looks very good !  
2. Pivo is good, but I found wrexham font on Dafont and it seems to me that it`s almost perfect ;-)

thank You for helping.

Ewelina

Glad to help.  
Regarding Wrexham: you need to know that it is a knock-off of [Monotype Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130630065514/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/monotype_script_std_bold/).
